instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT: What is PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT? PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the backlight on the LCD screen, this is necessary to get the screen to light up..
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Greetings to all, my name is Matteo .... I'm trying to learn something new about repairing these Macbooks. In question I have this model <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with pcb <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A, the device when connected to the power supply emits green and then orange light (even if the battery is disconnected), the fan runs but does not emit an image, nor back-up to the monitor. I tried to connect it to an external monitor by disconnecting the internal monitor, but with no results.
I checked all the voltages named Power Aliases on page 62 of the schematic, and I don't have the voltage on this line <SIGNAL>PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL>.....but the initial "BOING" sound not heard.
sorry for my english but i used a translator, do you have any help or ideas regarding my problem?

threads.title: Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Since 2013, MacBooks will automatically get amber light on Magsafe; even without battery connected.
It will switch back to green only when battery is fully charged.

Any history available for this board failure?

If you get VCORE, then check voltage at pins 7 & 3 of <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>.
Also check <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> level.

threads.title: Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Thanks for reply, 
on pin 7 and pin 3 of <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> have 3.42V
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> have 3.33V on <RESISTOR>R2071</RESISTOR>

About the history of this device not have nothing, costumer give me classic reply....yesterday working good and today nothing. I not find corrosion and pcb look good condition

threads.title: Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
What about pin 4/<CHIP>U2071</CHIP>?

Check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and their traces (page 46).
Also inspect <CHIP>U6101</CHIP> solders and traces.
Just in case, try known good BIOS; should be available on the forum.

threads.title: Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
About pin 4 on <CHIP>U2071</CHIP> have 3.33V
About the <CHIP>U6101</CHIP> is possible to give me the more info on this component? What role does it play?

For a good know bios, find on the forum?

threads.title: Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
<CHIP>U6101</CHIP> is used to enable Quad mode on <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> SPI chip.

You need to reprogram <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>.
Lot of information available on the forum, about BIOS reprogramming.

This file is reported as good:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1-GTjsIovc7u_NEAPXiRXHtBlZu_6DWma/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

threads.title: Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Hi, thank you again for your support and clarifications, I reprogrammed the bios with RT809H programmer, but the device remains with the same problem.
I also checked the resistance values on page 46 of the diagram as you suggested, everything seems ok .... but for the sake of scruple I will do a further check

threads.title: Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Be sure to have continuity between all these resistors.
Is J6100 clean?

threads.title: Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Ok, in the morning im check the value of this resistorsâ€¦.next step im check the continuity.
About the J6100, for me is ok
